## GAD-7 vs PIL

Comparing instruments such as the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Purpose in Life Questionnaire (PIL) can be an incredibly subjective and time-consuming task. This is where Harmony comes in. Harmony uses advanced AI and natural language processing to draw comparisons and quantify the matching degree between the items of GAD-7 and PIL, making the process of harmonisation more efficient and less prone to subjectivity. Whilst GAD-7 focuses on assessing the severity of generalised anxiety disorder, PIL is centred around understanding the individual's perspectives on their life's purpose and achieving their life goals. To uncover correlations or patterns across these two different psychological domains, GAD-7 vs PIL comparisons can be essential. With Harmony's AI capabilities, psychologists can obtain a numerical match percentage between the items of GAD-7 and PIL, guiding their further analyses and research. We encourage all psychologists to explore the GAD-7 vs PIL comparison capabilities of Harmony. The web interface is user-friendly; you can directly access it at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app and upload your own PDFs to use in comparisons. Beyond just GAD-7 vs PIL, it's a versatile tool that can facilitate the comparison of multiple instruments across different languages. By integrating Harmony, researchers and psychologists can streamline their data harmonisation processes, and enrich their studies and understanding of differing psychological realms.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and PIL

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and PIL into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PIL into Harmony</a> - compare PIL with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
